page.title: 18Trade
page.content: Most of their customers are local but they do have a stand at the Essex Show and advertise in local papers and Farmers Weekly. They are open every day of the week, including Sunday mornings at harvest and other busy times. The Black Bull is six hundred years old and is an old coaching inn. They employ twenty six people, most of the employees are part time. They serve about ninety meals each day at lunch time and evening. Lampetts (a six hundred year old farm house) is lived in by Dr& Mrs.Tompkins who cultivate a small vineyard as a hobby.They grow German grapes which arepicked early in the morning, packed into big skips and taken to Mr. White at Fyfield Hall to join his grapes on their journey to Kent where they are pressed and bottled.Wine sold locally.
